The following is a list of noteworthy issues fixed in :

ul.li: IMPALA-341 - Remote profiles are no longer ignored by the coordinator for the queries with the LIMIT clause.
IMPALA-941- Impala supports fully qualified table names that start with a number.
IMPALA-1048 - The query execution summary now includes the total time taken and memory consumed by the data sink at the root of each query fragment.
IMPALA-3323 - Fixed the issue where valid impala-shell options, such as --ldap_password_cmd, were unrecognized when the --config_file option was specified.

IMPALA-5397 - If a query has a dedicated coordinator, its end time is now set when the query releases its admission control resources. With no dedicated coordinator, the end time is set on un-registration.
IMPALA-5474 - Fixed an issue where adding a trivial subquery to a query with an error turns the error into a warning.
IMPALA-6521 - When set, experimental flags are now shown in /varz in web UI and log files.
IMPALA-6900 - INVALIDATE METADATA operation is no longer ignored when HMS is empty.
IMPALA-7446 - Impala enables buffer pool garbage collection when near process memory limit to prevent queries from spilling to disk earlier than necessary.
IMPALA-7659 - In COMPUTE STATS, Impala counts the number of NULL values in a table
IMPALA-7857 - Logs more information about StateStore failure detection.
IMPALA-7928 - To increase the efficiency of the HDFS file handle cache, remote reads for a particular file are scheduled to a consistent set of executor nodes.

IMPALA-7929 - Impala query on tables created via Hive and mapped to HBase failed with an internal exception because the qualifier of the HBase key column is null in the mapped table. Impala relaxed the requirement and allows a NULL qualifier.
IMPALA-7960 - Impala now returns a correct result when comparing TIMESTAMP to a string literal in a binary predicate where the TIMESTAMP is casted to VARCHAR of smaller length.
IMPALA-7961 - Fixed an issue where queries running with the SYNC_DDL query option can fail when the Catalog Server is under a heavy load with concurrent catalog operations of long-running DDLs.
IMPALA-8026 - Impala query profile now reports correct row counts for all nested loop join modes.
IMPALA-8061 - Impala correctly initializes S3_ACCESS_VALIDATED variable to zero when TARGET_FILESYSTEM=s3.
IMPALA-8154 - Disabled the Kerberos auth_to_local setting to prevent connection issues between impalads.
IMPALA-8188 - Impala now correctly detects an NVME device name and handles it.
IMPALA-8245 - Added hostname to the timeout error message to enable the user to easily identify the host which has reached a bad connection state with the HDFS NameNode.
IMPALA-8254 - COMPUTE STATS failed if COMPRESSION_CODEC is set.

concept.title: RuntimeState::error_log_ crashes

conbody.p: A crash could occur, with stack trace pointing to impala::RuntimeState::ErrorLog.
Severity: High

concept.title: HiveUdfCall::Open() produces unsynchronized access to JniUtil::global_refs_ vector

conbody.p: A crash could occur because of contention between multiple calls to Java UDFs.
Severity: High

concept.title: HBaseTableWriter::CreatePutList() produces unsynchronized access to JniUtil::global_refs_ vector

conbody.p: A crash could occur because of contention between multiple concurrent statements writing to HBase.
Severity: High

concept.title: Stress test failure: sorter.cc:745] Check failed: i == 0 (1 vs. 0)

conbody.p: A crash or wrong results could occur if the spill-to-disk mechanism encountered a zero-length string at the very end of a data block.
Severity: High

concept.title: String data coming out of agg can be corrupted by blocking operators

conbody.p: If a query plan contains an aggregation node producing string values anywhere within a subplan (that is,if in the SQL statement, the aggregate function appears within an inline view over a collection column), the results of the aggregation may be incorrect.
Severity: High

concept.title: CTAS with subquery throws AuthzException

conbody.p: A CREATE TABLE AS SELECT operation could fail with an authorization error, due to a slight difference in the privilege checking for the CTAS operation.
Severity: High

concept.title: Crash on inserting into table with binary and parquet

conbody.p: Impala incorrectly allowed BINARY to be specified as a column type, resulting in a crash during a write to a Parquet table with a column of that type.
Severity: High

concept.title: RowBatch::MaxTupleBufferSize() calculation incorrect, may lead to memory corruption

conbody.p: A crash could occur while querying tables with very large rows, for example wide tables with many columns or very large string values. This problem was identified in Impala 2.3, but had low reproducibility in subsequent releases. The fix ensures the memory allocation size is correct.
Severity: High

concept.title: Thrift buffer overflows when serialize more than 3355443200 bytes in impala

conbody.p: A very large memory allocation within the catalogd daemon could exceed an internal Thrift limit, causing a crash.
Severity: High

concept.title: Altering table partition's storage format is not working and crashing the daemon

conbody.p: If a partitioned table used a file format other than Avro, and the file format of an individual partition was changed to Avro, subsequent queries could encounter a crash.
Severity: High

concept.title: Race condition may cause scanners to spin with runtime filters on Avro or Sequence files

conbody.p: A timing problem during runtime filter processing could cause queries against Avro or SequenceFile tables to hang.
Severity: High

conbody.p: The following list contains the most critical issues (priority='Blocker') from the JIRA system. For the full list of fixed issues in , see .

concept.title: Stress test hit assert in LLVM: external function could not be resolved

conbody.p: The stress test was running a build with the TPC-H, TPC-DS, and TPC-H nested queries with scale factor 3.

concept.title: Impalad is crashing if udf jar is not available in hdfs location for first time

conbody.p: If a UDF JAR was not available in the HDFS location specified in the CREATE FUNCTION statement, the impalad daemon could crash.

concept.title: PAGG hits mem_limit when switching to I/O buffers

conbody.p: A join query could fail with an out-of-memory error despite the apparent presence of sufficient memory. The cause was the internal ordering of operations that could cause a later phase of the query to allocate memory required by an earlier phase of the query. The workaround was to either increase or decrease the MEM_LIMIT query option, because the issue would only occur for a specific combination of memory limit and data volume.

concept.title: Prevent migrating incorrectly inferred identity predicates into inline views

conbody.p: Referring to the same column twice in a view definition could cause the view to omit rows where that column contained a NULL value. This could cause incorrect results due to an inaccurate COUNT(*) value or rows missing from the result set.

concept.title: Fix migration/assignment of On-clause predicates inside inline views

conbody.p: Some combinations of ON clauses in join queries could result in comparisons being applied at the wrong stage of query processing, leading to incorrect results. Wrong predicate assignment could happen under the following conditions:

ul.li: The query includes an inline view that contains an outer join.
That inline view is joined with another table in the enclosing query block.
That join has an ON clause containing a predicate that only references columns originating from the outer-joined tables inside the inline view.

concept.title: Wrong plan of NOT IN aggregate subquery when a constant is used in subquery predicate

conbody.p: IN subqueries might return wrong results if the left-hand side of the IN is a constant. For example:
conbody.codeblock: select * from alltypestiny t1 where 10 not in (select sum(int_col) from alltypestiny);

concept.title: Parquet DictDecoders accumulate throughout query

conbody.p: Parquet dictionary decoders can accumulate throughout query execution, leading to excessive memory usage. One decoder is created per-column per-split.

concept.title: Planner doesn't set the has_local_target field correctly
MemPool allocation growth behavior

conbody.p: Currently, the MemPool would always double the size of the last allocation. This can lead to bad behavior if the MemPool transferred the ownership of all its data except the last chunk. In the next allocation, the next allocated chunk would double the size of this large chunk, which can be undesirable.

concept.title: Drop partition operations don't follow the catalog's locking protocol

conbody.p: The CatalogOpExecutor.alterTableDropPartition() function violates the locking protocol used in the catalog that requires catalogLock_ to be acquired before any table-level lock. That may cause deadlocks when ALTER TABLE DROP PARTITION is executed concurrently with other DDL operations.

concept.title: HAVING clause without aggregation not applied properly

conbody.p: A query with a HAVING clause but no GROUP BY clause was not being rejected, despite being invalid syntax. For example:
conbody.codeblock: select case when 1=1 then 'didit' end as c1 from (select 1 as one) a having 1!=1;

concept.title: Hit DCHECK Check failed: HasDateOrTime()

conbody.p: TimestampValue::ToTimestampVal() requires a valid TimestampValue as input. This requirement was not enforced in some places, leading to serious errors.

concept.title: Aggregation spill loop gives up too early leading to mem limit exceeded errors

conbody.p: An aggregation query could fail with an out-of-memory error, despite sufficient memory being reported as available.

concept.title: DataStreamSender::Channel::CloseInternal() does not close the channel on an error.

conbody.p: Some queries do not close an internal communication channel on an error. This will cause the node on the other side of the channel to wait indefinitely, causing the query to hang. For example, this issue could happen on a Kerberos-enabled system if the credential cache was outdated. Although the affected query hangs, the impalad daemons continue processing other queries.

concept.title: Codegen does not catch exceptions in FROM_UNIXTIME()

conbody.p: Querying for the min or max value of a timestamp cast from a bigint via from_unixtime() fails silently and crashes instances of impalad when the input includes a value outside of the valid range.
Workaround: Disable native code generation with:

concept.title: Impala returns wrong result for function 'conv(bigint, from_base, to_base)'

conbody.p: Impala returns wrong result for function conv(). Function conv(bigint, from_base, to_base) returns an correct result, while conv(string, from_base, to_base) returns the correct value. For example:
Workaround: Cast the value to string and use conv(string, from_base, to_base) for conversion.

concept.title: SEGV in AnalyticEvalNode touching NULL input_stream_

conbody.p: A query involving an analytic function could encounter a serious error. This issue was encountered infrequently, depending upon specific combinations of queries and data.

concept.title: Free local allocations per row batch in non-partitioned AGG and HJ

conbody.p: An outer join query could fail unexpectedly with an out-of-memory error when the spill to disk mechanism was turned off.

concept.title: Free local allocations once for every row batch when building hash tables

conbody.p: A join query could encounter a serious error due to an internal failure to allocate memory, which resulted in dereferencing a NULL pointer.

concept.title: Prevent migrating incorrectly inferred identity predicates into inline views

conbody.p: Referring to the same column twice in a view definition could cause the view to omit rows where that column contained a NULL value. This could cause incorrect results due to an inaccurate COUNT(*) value or rows missing from the result set.

concept.title: Fix GRANTs on URIs with uppercase letters

conbody.p: A GRANT statement for a URI could be ineffective if the URI contained uppercase letters, for example in an uppercase directory name. Subsequent statements, such as CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE with a LOCATION clause, could fail with an authorization exception.

concept.title: Avoid sending large partition stats objects over thrift

conbody.p: The catalogd daemon could encounter a serious error when loading the incremental statistics metadata for tables with large numbers of partitions and columns. The problem occurred when the internal representation of metadata for the table exceeded 2 GB, for example in a table with 20K partitions and 77 columns. The fix causes a COMPUTE INCREMENTAL STATS operation to fail if it would produce metadata that exceeded the maximum size.
Bug: IMPALA-2664, IMPALA-2648

concept.title: Throw AnalysisError if table properties are too large (for the Hive metastore)

conbody.p: CREATE TABLE or ALTER TABLE statements could fail with metastore database errors due to length limits on the SERDEPROPERTIES and TBLPROPERTIES clauses. (The limit on key size is 256, while the limit on value size is 4000.) The fix makes Impala handle these error conditions more cleanly, by detecting too-long values rather than passing them to the metastore database.

concept.title: Make MAX_PAGE_HEADER_SIZE configurable

conbody.p: Impala could fail to access Parquet data files with page headers larger than 8 MB, which could occur, for example, if the minimum or maximum values for a column were long strings. The fix adds a configuration setting --max_page_header_size, which you can use to increase the Impala size limit to a value higher than 8 MB.

concept.title: reduce scanner memory usage

conbody.p: Queries on Parquet tables could consume excessive memory (potentially multiple gigabytes) due to producing large intermediate data values while evaluating groups of rows. The workaround was to reduce the size of the NUM_SCANNER_THREADS query option, the BATCH_SIZE query option, or both.

concept.title: Handle error when distinct and aggregates are used with a having clause

conbody.p: A query that included a DISTINCT operator and a HAVING clause, but no aggregate functions or GROUP BY, would fail with an uninformative error message.

concept.title: Handle error when star based select item and aggregate are incorrectly used

conbody.p: A query that included * in the SELECT list, in addition to an aggregate function call, would fail with an uninformative message if the query had no GROUP BY clause.

concept.title: Refactor MemPool usage in HBase scan node

conbody.p: Queries involving HBase tables used substantially more memory than in earlier Impala versions. The problem occurred starting in Impala 2.2.8, as a result of the changes for IMPALA-2284. The fix for this issue involves removing a separate memory work area for HBase queries and reusing other memory that was already allocated.

concept.title: Fix migration/assignment of On-clause predicates inside inline views

conbody.p: Some combinations of ON clauses in join queries could result in comparisons being applied at the wrong stage of query processing, leading to incorrect results. Wrong predicate assignment could happen under the following conditions:

ul.li: The query includes an inline view that contains an outer join.
That inline view is joined with another table in the enclosing query block.
That join has an ON clause containing a predicate that only references columns originating from the outer-joined tables inside the inline view.

concept.title: DCHECK in parquet scanner after block read error

conbody.p: A debug build of Impala could encounter a serious error after encountering some kinds of I/O errors for Parquet files. This issue only occurred in debug builds, not release builds.

concept.title: PAGG hits mem_limit when switching to I/O buffers

conbody.p: A join query could fail with an out-of-memory error despite the apparent presence of sufficient memory. The cause was the internal ordering of operations that could cause a later phase of the query to allocate memory required by an earlier phase of the query. The workaround was to either increase or decrease the MEM_LIMIT query option, because the issue would only occur for a specific combination of memory limit and data volume.

concept.title: Fix check failed: sorter_runs_.back()->is_pinned_

conbody.p: A query could fail with an internal error while calculating the memory limit. This was an infrequent condition uncovered during stress testing.

concept.title: Don't ignore Status returned by DataStreamRecvr::CreateMerger()

conbody.p: A query could fail with an internal error while calculating the memory limit. This was an infrequent condition uncovered during stress testing.
Bug: IMPALA-2614, IMPALA-2559

concept.title: DataStreamSender::Send() does not return an error status if SendBatch() failed
Re-enable SSL and Kerberos on server-server

conbody.p: These fixes lift the restriction on using SSL encryption and Kerberos authentication together for internal communication between Impala components.
Bug: IMPALA-2598, IMPALA-2747

concept.title: Query return empty result if it contains NullLiteral in inlineview

conbody.p: If an inline view in a FROM clause contained a NULL literal, the result set was empty.

conbody.p: Queries involving HBase tables used substantially more memory than in earlier Impala versions. The problem occurred starting in Impala 2.2.8, as a result of the changes for IMPALA-2284. The fix for this issue involves removing a separate memory work area for HBase queries and reusing other memory that was already allocated.

conbody.p: Some combinations of ON clauses in join queries could result in comparisons being applied at the wrong stage of query processing, leading to incorrect results. Wrong predicate assignment could happen under the following conditions:

ul.li: The query includes an inline view that contains an outer join.
That inline view is joined with another table in the enclosing query block.
That join has an ON clause containing a predicate that only references columns originating from the outer-joined tables inside the inline view.

concept.title: Fix wrong predicate assignment in outer joins

conbody.p: The join predicate for an OUTER JOIN clause could be applied at the wrong stage of query processing, leading to incorrect results.

concept.title: Avoid sending large partition stats objects over thrift

conbody.p: The catalogd daemon could encounter a serious error when loading the incremental statistics metadata for tables with large numbers of partitions and columns. The problem occurred when the internal representation of metadata for the table exceeded 2 GB, for example in a table with 20K partitions and 77 columns. The fix causes a COMPUTE INCREMENTAL STATS operation to fail if it would produce metadata that exceeded the maximum size.
Bug: IMPALA-2648, IMPALA-2664

concept.title: Avoid overflow when adding large intervals to TIMESTAMPs

conbody.p: Adding or subtracting a large INTERVAL value to a TIMESTAMP value could produce an incorrect result, with the value wrapping instead of returning an out-of-range error.

concept.title: Analysis exception when a binary operator contains an IN operator with values

conbody.p: An IN operator with literal values could cause a statement to fail if used as the argument to a binary operator, such as an equality test for a BOOLEAN value.

concept.title: Make MAX_PAGE_HEADER_SIZE configurable

conbody.p: Impala could fail to access Parquet data files with page headers larger than 8 MB, which could occur, for example, if the minimum or maximum values for a column were long strings. The fix adds a configuration setting --max_page_header_size, which you can use to increase the Impala size limit to a value higher than 8 MB.

concept.title: Fix spilling sorts with var-len slots that are NULL or empty.

conbody.p: A query that activated the spill-to-disk mechanism could fail if it contained a sort expression involving certain combinations of fixed-length or variable-length types.

concept.title: Work-around IMPALA-2344: Fail query with OOM in case block->Pin() fails

conbody.p: Some queries that activated the spill-to-disk mechanism could produce a serious error if there was insufficient memory to set up internal work areas. Now those queries produce normal out-of-memory errors instead.

concept.title: Crash (likely race) tearing down BufferedBlockMgr on query failure

conbody.p: A serious error could occur under rare circumstances, due to a race condition while freeing memory during heavily concurrent workloads.

concept.title: QueryExecState doesn't check for query cancellation or errors

conbody.p: A call to SetError() in a user-defined function (UDF) would not cause the query to fail as expected.

concept.title: Impala throws IllegalStateException when inserting data into a partition while select subquery group by partition columns

conbody.p: An INSERT ... SELECT operation into a partitioned table could fail if the SELECT query included a GROUP BY clause referring to the partition key columns.

concept.title: Impala is unable to read hive tables created with the "STORED AS AVRO" clause

conbody.p: Impala could not read Avro tables created in Hive with the STORED AS AVRO clause.
Bug: IMPALA-1136, IMPALA-2161

concept.title: make Parquet scanner fail query if the file size metadata is stale

conbody.p: If a Parquet file in HDFS was overwritten by a smaller file, Impala could encounter a serious error. Issuing a INVALIDATE METADATA statement before a subsequent query would avoid the error. The fix allows Impala to handle such inconsistencies in Parquet file length cleanly regardless of whether the table metadata is up-to-date.

concept.title: Avoid allocating StringBuffer > 1GB in ScannerContext::Stream::GetBytesInternal()

conbody.p: Impala could encounter a serious error when reading compressed text files larger than 1 GB. The fix causes Impala to issue an error message instead in this case.

concept.title: Disallow long (1<<30) strings in group_concat()

conbody.p: A query using the group_concat() function could encounter a serious error if the returned string value was larger than 1 GB. Now the query fails with an error message in this case.

concept.title: avoid FnvHash64to32 with empty inputs

conbody.p: An edge case in the algorithm used to distribute data among nodes could result in uneven distribution of work for some queries, with all data sent to the same node.

concept.title: The catalog does not close the connection to HMS during table invalidation

conbody.p: A communication error could occur between Impala and the Hive metastore database, causing Impala operations that update table metadata to fail.

concept.title: Wrong DCHECK in PHJ::ProcessProbeBatch

conbody.p: Certain queries could encounter a serious error if the spill-to-disk mechanism was activated.

concept.title: Avoid cardinality 0 in scan nodes of small tables and low selectivity

conbody.p: Impala could generate a suboptimal query plan for some queries involving small tables.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in

conbody.p: This section lists the most frequently encountered customer issues fixed in .

concept.title: Warn if table stats are potentially corrupt.

conbody.p: Impala warns if it detects a discrepancy in table statistics: a table considered to have zero rows even though there are data files present. In this case, Impala also skips query optimizations that are normally applied to very small tables.

concept.title: Pass correct child node in 2nd phase merge aggregation.

conbody.p: A query could encounter a serious error if it included a particular combination of aggregate functions and inline views.

concept.title: Set the output smap of an EmptySetNode produced from an empty inline view.

conbody.p: A query could encounter a serious error if it included an inline view whose subquery had no FROM clause.

concept.title: Set an InsertStmt's result exprs from the source statement's result exprs.

conbody.p: A CREATE TABLE AS SELECT or INSERT ... SELECT statement could produce different results than a SELECT statement, for queries including a FULL JOIN clause and including literal values in the select list.

concept.title: Fix planning of empty union operands with analytics.

conbody.p: A query could return incorrect results if it contained a UNION clause, calls to analytic functions, and a constant expression that evaluated to FALSE.

concept.title: Retain eq predicates bound by grouping slots with complex grouping exprs.

conbody.p: A query containing an INNER JOIN clause could return undesired rows. Some predicate specified in the ON clause could be omitted from the filtering operation.

concept.title: Row count not set for empty partition when spec is used with compute incremental stats

conbody.p: A COMPUTE INCREMENTAL STATS statement could leave the row count for an emptyp partition as -1, rather than initializing the row count to 0. The missing statistic value could result in reduced query performance.

concept.title: Explicit aliases + ordinals analysis bug

conbody.p: A query could encounter a serious error if it included column aliases with the same names as table columns, and used ordinal numbers in an ORDER BY or GROUP BY clause.

concept.title: Fix TupleIsNullPredicate to return false if no tuples are nullable.

conbody.p: A query could return incorrect results if it included an outer join clause, inline views, and calls to functions such as coalesce() that can generate NULL values.

concept.title: fix Expr::ComputeResultsLayout() logic

conbody.p: A query could return incorrect results if the table contained multiple CHAR columns with length of 2 or less, and the query included a GROUP BY clause that referred to multiple such columns.

concept.title: Substitute an InsertStmt's partition key exprs with the root node's smap.

conbody.p: An INSERT statement could encounter a serious error if the SELECT portion called an analytic function.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Impala

conbody.p: This section lists the most frequently encountered customer issues fixed in .

concept.title: Impala DML/DDL operations corrupt table metadata leading to Hive query failures

conbody.p: When the Impala COMPUTE STATS statement was run on a partitioned Parquet table that was created in Hive, the table subsequently became inaccessible in Hive. The table was still accessible to Impala. Regaining access in Hive required a workaround of creating a new table. The error displayed in Hive was:
conbody.codeblock: Error: Error while compiling statement: FAILED: SemanticException Class not found: org.apache.impala.hive.serde.ParquetInputFormat (state=42000,code=40000)

concept.title: Avoiding a DCHECK of NULL hash table in spilled right joins

conbody.p: A query could encounter a serious error if it contained a RIGHT OUTER, RIGHT ANTI, or FULL OUTER join clause and approached the memory limit on a host so that the spill to disk mechanism was activated.

concept.title: Bug in PrintTColumnValue caused wrong stats for TINYINT partition cols

conbody.p: Declaring a partition key column as a TINYINT caused problems with the COMPUTE STATS statement. The associated partitions would always have zero estimated rows, leading to potential inefficient query plans.

concept.title: Where clause does not propagate to joins inside nested views

conbody.p: A query that referred to a view whose query referred to another view containing a join, could return incorrect results. WHERE clauses for the outermost query were not always applied, causing the result set to include additional rows that should have been filtered out.

concept.title: Add effective_user() builtin

conbody.p: The user() function returned the name of the logged-in user, which might not be the same as the user name being checked for authorization if, for example, delegation was enabled.
Resolution: Rather than change the behavior of the user() function, the fix introduces an additional function effective_user() that returns the user name that is checked during authorization.

concept.title: Make UTC to local TimestampValue conversion faster.

conbody.p: Query performance was improved substantially for Parquet files containing TIMESTAMP data written by Hive, when the -convert_legacy_hive_parquet_utc_timestamps=true setting is in effect.

concept.title: Workaround IMPALA-1619 in BufferedBlockMgr::ConsumeMemory()

conbody.p: A join query could encounter a serious error if the query approached the memory limit on a host so that the spill to disk mechanism was activated, and data volume in the join was large enough that an internal memory buffer exceeded 1 GB in size on a particular host. (Exceeding this limit would only happen for huge join queries, because Impala could split this intermediate data into 16 parts during the join query, and the buffer only contains compact bookkeeping data rather than the actual join column data.)

concept.title: Issues Fixed in

conbody.p: This section lists the most frequently encountered customer issues fixed in .

concept.title: Enable using Isilon as the underlying filesystem.

conbody.p: Enabling Impala to work with the Isilon filesystem involves a number of fixes to performance and flexibility for dealing with I/O using remote reads. See for details on using Impala and Isilon together.
Bug: IMPALA-1968, IMPALA-1730

concept.title: Expand set of supported timezones.

conbody.p: The set of timezones recognized by Impala was expanded. You can always find the latest list of supported timezones in the Impala source code, in the file timezone_db.cc.

concept.title: Impala Timestamp ISO-8601 Support.

concept.title: Altering a column's type causes column stats to stop sticking for that column

conbody.p: When the type of a column was changed in either Hive or Impala through ALTER TABLE CHANGE COLUMN, the metastore database did not correctly propagate that change to the table that contains the column statistics. The statistics (particularly the NDV) for that column were permanently reset and could not be changed by Impala's COMPUTE STATS command. The underlying cause is a Hive bug (HIVE-9866).
Resolution: Resolved by incorporating the fix for HIVE-9866.
Workaround: On systems without the corresponding Hive fix, change the column back to its original type. The stats reappear and you can recompute or drop them.

conbody.p: Impala could issue messages stating the block locality metadata was stale, when the metadata was actually fine. The internal remote bytes read counter was not being reset properly. conbody.p: Impala could allocate more memory than necessary during certain operations.

Workaround: Before issuing a COMPUTE STATS statement for a Parquet table, reduce the number of threads used in that operation by issuing SET NUM_SCANNER_THREADS=2 in impala-shell. Then issue UNSET NUM_SCANNER_THREADS before continuing with queries.

concept.title: Impala should provide an option for new sub directories to automatically inherit the permissions of the parent directory

conbody.p: When new subdirectories are created underneath a partitioned table by an INSERT statement, previously the new subdirectories always used the default HDFS permissions for the impala user, which might not be suitable for directories intended to be read and written by other components also.
Resolution: In Impala 1.3.1 and higher, you can specify the --insert_inherit_permissions configuration when starting the impalad daemon.

concept.title: Illegal state exception (or crash) in query with UNION in inline view

conbody.p: Impala could encounter a severe error in a query where the FROM list contains an inline view that includes a UNION. The exact type of the error varies.

concept.title: INSERT column reordering doesn't work with SELECT clause

conbody.p: The ability to specify a subset of columns in an INSERT statement, with order different than in the target table, was not working as intended.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Impala 1.3.0

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.3.0, primarily issues that could cause wrong results, or cause problems running the COMPUTE STATS statement, which is very important for performance and scalability.
For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Inner join after right join may produce wrong results

conbody.p: The automatic join reordering optimization could incorrectly reorder queries with an outer join or semi join followed by an inner join, producing incorrect results.
Workaround: Including the STRAIGHT_JOIN keyword in the query prevented the issue from occurring.

concept.title: Incorrect results with codegen on multi-column group by with NULLs.

conbody.p: A query with a GROUP BY clause referencing multiple columns could introduce incorrect NULL values in some columns of the result set. The incorrect NULL values could appear in rows where a different GROUP BY column actually did return NULL.

concept.title: Using distinct inside aggregate function may cause incorrect result when using having clause

conbody.p: A query could return incorrect results if it combined an aggregate function call, a DISTINCT operator, and a HAVING clause, without a GROUP BY clause.

concept.title: Aggregation on union inside (inline) view not distributed properly.

conbody.p: An aggregation query or a query with ORDER BY and LIMIT could be executed on a single node in some cases, rather than distributed across the cluster. This issue affected queries whose FROM clause referenced an inline view containing a UNION.

concept.title: Wrong expression may be used in aggregate query if there are multiple similar expressions

conbody.p: If a GROUP BY query referenced the same columns multiple times using different operators, result rows could contain multiple copies of the same expression.

concept.title: Incorrect results when changing the order of aggregates in the select list with codegen enabled

conbody.p: Referencing the same columns in both a COUNT() and a SUM() call in the same query, or some other combinations of aggregate function calls, could incorrectly return a result of 0 from one of the aggregate functions. This issue affected references to TINYINT and SMALLINT columns, but not INT or BIGINT columns.
Workaround: Setting the query option DISABLE_CODEGEN=TRUE prevented the incorrect results. Switching the order of the function calls could also prevent the issue from occurring.

concept.title: Union queries give Wrong result in a UNION followed by SIGSEGV in another union

conbody.p: A UNION query could produce a wrong result, followed by a serious error for a subsequent UNION query.

concept.title: String data in MR-produced parquet files may be read incorrectly

conbody.p: Impala could return incorrect string results when reading uncompressed Parquet data files containing multiple row groups. This issue only affected Parquet data files produced by MapReduce jobs.

concept.title: Compute stats need to use quotes with identifiers that are Impala keywords

conbody.p: Using a column or table name that conflicted with Impala keywords could prevent running the COMPUTE STATS statement for the table.

concept.title: COMPUTE STATS child queries do not inherit parent query options.

conbody.p: The COMPUTE STATS statement did not use the setting of the MEM_LIMIT query option in impala-shell, potentially causing problems gathering statistics for wide Parquet tables.

concept.title: COMPUTE STATS should update partitions in batches

conbody.p: The COMPUTE STATS statement could be slow or encounter a timeout while analyzing a table with many partitions.

concept.title: Fail early (in analysis) when COMPUTE STATS is run against Avro table with no columns

conbody.p: If the columns for an Avro table were all defined in the TBLPROPERTIES or SERDEPROPERTIES clauses, the COMPUTE STATS statement would fail after completely analyzing the table, potentially causing a long delay. Although the COMPUTE STATS statement still does not work for such tables, now the problem is detected and reported immediately.
Workaround: Re-create the Avro table with columns defined in SQL style, using the output of SHOW CREATE TABLE. (See the JIRA page for detailed steps.)

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.2.4 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.2.4. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: The Catalog Server exits with an OOM error after a certain number of CREATE statements

conbody.p: A large number of concurrent CREATE TABLE statements can cause the catalogd process to consume excessive memory, and potentially be killed due to an out-of-memory condition.
Workaround: Restart the catalogd service and re-try the DDL operations that failed.

concept.title: Catalog Server consumes excessive cpu cycle

conbody.p: A large number of tables and partitions could result in unnecessary CPU overhead during Impala idle time and background operations.
Resolution: Catalog server processing was optimized in several ways.

concept.title: Query against Avro table crashes Impala with codegen enabled

conbody.p: A query against a TIMESTAMP column in an Avro table could encounter a serious issue.
Workaround: Set the query option DISABLE_CODEGEN=TRUE

concept.title: Statestore seems to send concurrent heartbeats to the same subscriber leading to repeated "Subscriber 'hostname' is registering with statestore, ignoring update" messages

conbody.p: Impala nodes could produce repeated error messages after recovering from a communication error with the statestore service.

concept.title: Join predicate incorrectly ignored

conbody.p: A join query could produce wrong results if multiple equality comparisons between the same tables referred to the same column.

concept.title: Query result differing between Impala and Hive

conbody.p: Certain outer join queries could return wrong results. If one of the tables involved in the join was an inline view, some tests from the WHERE clauses could be applied to the wrong phase of the query.

concept.title: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException / Invalid query handle when reading large HBase cell

conbody.p: An HBase cell could contain a value larger than 32 KB, leading to a serious error when Impala queries that table. The error could occur even if the applicable row is not part of the result set.
Workaround: Use smaller values in the HBase table, or exclude the column containing the large value from the result set.

concept.title: select with distinct and full outer join, impalad coredump

conbody.p: A query involving a DISTINCT operator combined with a FULL OUTER JOIN could encounter a serious error.
Workaround: Set the query option DISABLE_CODEGEN=TRUE

concept.title: Impala cannot load tables with more than Short.MAX_VALUE number of partitions

conbody.p: If a table had more than 32,767 partitions, Impala would not recognize the partitions above the 32K limit and query results could be incomplete.

concept.title: Various issues with HBase row key specification

conbody.p: Queries against HBase tables could fail with an error if the row key was compared to a function return value rather than a string constant. Also, queries against HBase tables could fail if the WHERE clause contained combinations of comparisons that could not possibly match any row key.

Resolution: Queries now return appropriate results when function calls are used in the row key comparison. For queries involving non-existent row keys, such as WHERE row_key IS NULL or where the lower bound is greater than the upper bound, the query succeeds and returns an empty result set.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.2.3 Release

conbody.p: This release is a fix release that supercedes Impala 1.2.2, with the same features and fixes as 1.2.2 plus one additional fix for compatibility with Parquet files generated outside of Impala by components such as Hive, Pig, or MapReduce.

concept.title: Impala cannot read Parquet files with multiple row groups

conbody.p: An early version of the parquet-mr library writes files that are not readable by Impala, due to the presence of multiple row groups. Queries involving these data files might result in a crash or a failure with an error such as Column chunk should not contain two dictionary pages.
This issue does not occur for Parquet files produced by Impala INSERT statements, because Impala only produces files with a single row group.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.2.2 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.2.2. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

conbody.p: Impala does not currently optimize the join order of queries; instead, it joins tables in the order in which they are listed in the FROM clause. Queries that contain one or more large tables on the right hand side of joins (either an explicit join expressed as a JOIN statement or a join implicit in the list of table references in the FROM clause) may run slowly or crash Impala due to out-of-memory errors. concept.title: Parquet in CDH4.5 writes data files that are sometimes unreadable by Impala

conbody.p: Some Parquet files could be generated by other components that Impala could not read.
Resolution: The underlying issue is being addressed by a fix in the Parquet libraries. Impala 1.2.2 works around the problem and reads the existing data files.

concept.title: Deadlock in statestore when unregistering a subscriber and building a topic update

conbody.p: The statestore service cound experience an internal error leading to a hang.

concept.title: IllegalStateException when doing a union involving a group by

conbody.p: A UNION query where one side involved a GROUP BY operation could cause a serious error.

concept.title: Impala Parquet Writer hit DCHECK in RleEncoder

conbody.p: A serious error could occur when doing an INSERT into a Parquet table.

concept.title: Hive UDF jars cannot be loaded by the FE

conbody.p: If the JAR file for a Java-based Hive UDF was not in the CLASSPATH, the UDF could not be called during a query.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.2.1 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.2.1. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Scanners use too much memory when reading past scan range

conbody.p: While querying a table with long column values, Impala could over-allocate memory leading to an out-of-memory error. This problem was observed most frequently with tables using uncompressed RCFile or text data files.
Resolution: Fixed in 1.2.1

concept.title: Join node consumes memory way beyond mem-limit

conbody.p: A join query could allocate a temporary work area that was larger than needed, leading to an out-of-memory error. The fix makes Impala return unused memory to the system when the memory limit is reached, avoiding unnecessary memory errors.
Resolution: Fixed in 1.2.1

concept.title: Excessive memory consumption when query tables with 1k columns (Parquet file)

conbody.p: Impala could encounter an out-of-memory condition setting up work areas for Parquet tables with many columns. The fix reduces the size of the allocated memory when not actually needed to hold table data.
Resolution: Fixed in 1.2.1

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.2.0 Beta Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.2 (beta). For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.1.1 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.1.1. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Unexpected LLVM Crash When Querying Doubles on CentOS 5.x

conbody.p: Certain queries involving DOUBLE columns could fail with a serious error. The fix improves the generation of native machine instructions for certain chipsets.

concept.title: "block size is too big" error with Snappy-compressed RCFile containing null

conbody.p: Queries could fail with a block size is too big error, due to NULL values in RCFile tables using Snappy compression.

concept.title: Cannot query RC file for table that has more columns than the data file

conbody.p: Queries could fail if an Impala RCFile table was defined with more columns than in the corresponding RCFile data files.

concept.title: Views Sometimes Not Utilizing Partition Pruning

conbody.p: Certain combinations of clauses in a view definition for a partitioned table could result in inefficient performance and incorrect results.

concept.title: Update the serde name we write into the metastore for Parquet tables

conbody.p: The SerDes class string written into Parquet data files created by Impala was updated for compatibility with Parquet support in Hive. See for the steps to update older Parquet data files for Hive compatibility.

concept.title: Selective queries over large tables produce unnecessary memory consumption

conbody.p: A query returning a small result sets from a large table could tie up memory unnecessarily for the duration of the query.

concept.title: Impala stopped to query AVRO tables

conbody.p: Queries against Avro tables could fail depending on whether the Avro schema URL was specified in the TBLPROPERTIES or SERDEPROPERTIES field. The fix causes Impala to check both fields for the schema URL.

concept.title: Impala continues to allocate more memory even though it has exceed its mem-limit

conbody.p: Queries could allocate substantially more memory than specified in the impalad -mem_limit startup option. The fix causes more frequent checking of the limit during query execution.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.1.0 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.1. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: 10-20% perf regression for most queries across all table formats

conbody.p: This issue is due to a performance tradeoff between systems running many queries concurrently, and systems running a single query. Systems running only a single query could experience lower performance than in early beta releases. Systems running many queries simultaneously should experience higher performance than in the beta releases.

concept.title: planner fails with "Join requires at least one equality predicate between the two tables" when "from" table order does not match "where" join order

conbody.p: A query could fail if it involved 3 or more tables and the last join table was specified as a subquery.

concept.title: Parquet writer uses excessive memory with partitions

conbody.p: INSERT statements against partitioned tables using the Parquet format could use excessive amounts of memory as the number of partitions grew large.

concept.title: Comments in impala-shell in interactive mode are not handled properly causing syntax errors or wrong results

conbody.p: The impala-shell interpreter did not accept comment entered at the command line, making it problematic to copy and paste from scripts or other code examples.

concept.title: Cancelled queries sometimes aren't removed from the inflight query list

conbody.p: The Impala web UI would sometimes display a query as if it were still running, after the query was cancelled.

concept.title: Impala's 1.0.1 Shell Broke Python 2.4 Compatibility (AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'field_size_limit)

conbody.p: The impala-shell command in Impala 1.0.1 does not work with Python 2.4, which is the default on Red Hat 5.
For the impala-shell command in Impala 1.0, the -o option (pipe output to a file) does not work with Python 2.4.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.0.1 Release

conbody.p: This section lists the most significant issues fixed in Impala 1.0.1. For the full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Impala parquet scanner cannot read all data files generated by other frameworks

conbody.p: Impala might issue an erroneous error message when processing a Parquet data file produced by a non-Impala Hadoop component.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Impala is unable to query RCFile tables which describe fewer columns than the file's header.

conbody.p: If an RCFile table definition had fewer columns than the fields actually in the data files, queries would fail.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Impala does not correctly substitute _HOST with hostname in --principal

conbody.p: The _HOST placeholder in the --principal startup option was not substituted with the correct hostname, potentially leading to a startup error in setups using Kerberos authentication.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: HBase query missed the last region

conbody.p: A query for an HBase table could omit data from the last region.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Hbase region changes are not handled correctly

conbody.p: After a region in an HBase table was split or moved, an Impala query might return incomplete or out-of-date results.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Query state for successful create table is EXCEPTION

conbody.p: After a successful CREATE TABLE statement, the corresponding query state would be incorrectly reported as EXCEPTION.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Double check release of JNI-allocated byte-strings

conbody.p: Operations involving calls to the Java JNI subsystem (for example, queries on HBase tables) could allocate memory but not release it.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Impala returns 0 for bad time values in UNIX_TIMESTAMP, Hive returns NULL

conbody.p: Impala returns 0 for bad time values in UNIX_TIMESTAMP, Hive returns NULL.
conbody.codeblock: hive> select UNIX_TIMESTAMP('10:02:01') FROM tmp; hive> NULL
conbody.p: Anticipated Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: INSERT INTO TABLE SELECT <constant> does not work.

conbody.p: Insert INTO TABLE SELECT <constant> will not insert any data and may return an error.
Anticipated Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Issues Fixed in the 1.0 GA Release

conbody.p: Here are the major user-visible issues fixed in Impala 1.0. For a full list of fixed issues, see .

concept.title: Undeterministically receive "ERROR: unknown row bach destination..." and "ERROR: Invalid query handle" from impala shell when running union query

conbody.p: A query containing both UNION and LIMIT clauses could intermittently cause the impalad process to halt with a segmentation fault.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Insert with NULL partition keys results in SIGSEGV.

conbody.p: An INSERT statement specifying a NULL value for one of the partitioning columns could cause the impalad process to halt with a segmentation fault.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: INSERT queries don't show completed profiles on the debug webpage

conbody.p: In the Impala web user interface, the profile page for an INSERT statement showed obsolete information for the statement once it was complete.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Impala HBase scan is very slow

conbody.p: Queries involving an HBase table could be slower than expected, due to excessive memory usage on the Impala nodes.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Add some library version validation logic to impalad when loading impala-lzo shared library

conbody.p: No validation was done to check that the impala-lzo shared library was compatible with the version of Impala, possibly leading to a crash when using LZO-compressed text files.
Resolution: Fixed
Workaround: Always upgrade the impala-lzo library at the same time as you upgrade Impala itself.

concept.title: Problems inserting into tables with TIMESTAMP partition columns leading table metadata loading failures and failed dchecks

conbody.p: INSERT statements for tables partitioned on columns involving datetime types could appear to succeed, but cause errors for subsequent queries on those tables. The problem was especially serious if an improperly formatted timestamp value was specified for the partition key.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Ctrl-C sometimes interrupts shell in system call, rather than cancelling query

conbody.p: Pressing Ctrl-C in the impala-shell interpreter could sometimes display an error and return control to the shell, making it impossible to cancel the query.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Empty string partition value causes metastore update failure

conbody.p: Specifying an empty string or NULL for a partition key in an INSERT statement would fail.
Resolution: Fixed. The behavior for empty partition keys was made more compatible with the corresponding Hive behavior.

concept.title: Round() does not output the right precision

conbody.p: The round() function did not always return the correct number of significant digits.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Cannot cast string literal to string

conbody.p: Casting from a string literal back to the same type would cause an invalid type cast error rather than leaving the original value unchanged.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Excessive mem usage for certain queries which are very selective

conbody.p: Some queries that returned very few rows experienced unnecessary memory usage.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: HdfsScanNode crashes in UpdateCounters

conbody.p: A serious error could occur for relatively small and inexpensive queries.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Parquet performance issues on large dataset

conbody.p: Certain aggregation queries against Parquet tables were inefficient due to lower than required thread utilization.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: impala not populating hive metadata correctly for create table

conbody.p: The Impala CREATE TABLE command did not fill in the owner and tbl_type columns in the Hive metastore database.
Resolution: Fixed. The metadata was made more Hive-compatible.

concept.title: impala daemons die if statestore goes down

conbody.p: The impalad instances in a cluster could halt when the statestored process became unavailable.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Constant SELECT clauses do not work in subqueries

conbody.p: A subquery would fail if the SELECT statement inside it returned a constant value rather than querying a table.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Right outer Join includes NULLs as well and hence wrong result count

conbody.p: The result set from a right outer join query could include erroneous rows containing NULL values.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Parquet scanner hangs for some queries

conbody.p: The Parquet scanner non-deterministically hangs when executing some queries.
Resolution: Fixed

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.7 of the Beta Release
Impala does not gracefully handle unsupported Hive table types (INDEX and VIEW tables)

conbody.p: When attempting to load metadata from an unsupported Hive table type (INDEX and VIEW tables), Impala fails with an unclear error message.
Bug: IMPALA-167
Resolution: Fixed in 0.7

concept.title: DDL statements (CREATE/ALTER/DROP TABLE) are not supported in the Impala Beta Release

conbody.p: Resolution: Fixed in 0.7

concept.title: Avro is not supported in the Impala Beta Release

conbody.p: Resolution: Fixed in 0.7
Workaround: None

concept.title: Impala does not currently allow limiting the memory consumption of a single query

conbody.p: It is currently not possible to limit the memory consumption of a single query. All tables on the right hand side of JOIN statements need to be able to fit in memory. If they do not, Impala may crash due to out of memory errors.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.7

concept.title: Aggregate of a subquery result set returns wrong results if the subquery contains a 'limit' and data is distributed across multiple nodes

conbody.p: Aggregate of a subquery result set returns wrong results if the subquery contains a 'limit' clause and data is distributed across multiple nodes. From the query plan, it looks like we are just summing the results from each worker node.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.7

concept.title: Partition pruning for arbitrary predicates that are fully bound by a particular partition column

conbody.p: We currently cannot utilize a predicate like "country_code in ('DE', 'FR', 'US')" to do partitioning pruning, because that requires an equality predicate or a binary comparison.

We should create a superclass of planner.ValueRange, ValueSet, that can be constructed with an arbitrary predicate, and whose isInRange(analyzer, valueExpr) constructs a literal predicate by substitution of the valueExpr into the predicate.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.7

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.6 of the Beta Release
Impala reads the NameNode address and port as command line parameters

conbody.p: Impala reads the NameNode address and port as command line parameters rather than reading them from core-site.xml. Updating the NameNode address in the core-site.xml file does not propagate to Impala.
Severity: Low

Resolution: Fixed in 0.6 - Impala reads the namenode location and port from the Hadoop configuration files, though setting -nn and -nn_port overrides this. Users are advised not to set -nn or -nn_port.

concept.title: Queries may fail on secure environment due to impalad Kerberos ticket expiration

conbody.p: Queries may fail on secure environment due to impalad Kerberos tickets expiring. This can happen if the Impala -kerberos_reinit_interval flag is set to a value ten minutes or less. This may lead to an impalad requesting a ticket with a lifetime that is less than the time to the next ticket renewal.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.6

concept.title: Concurrent queries may fail when Impala uses Thrift to communicate with the Hive Metastore

conbody.p: Concurrent queries may fail when Impala is using Thrift to communicate with part of the Hive Metastore such as the Hive Metastore Service. In such a case, the error get_fields failed: out of sequence response" may occur because Impala shared a single Hive Metastore Client connection across threads. With Impala 0.6, a separate connection is used for each metadata request.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.6

concept.title: impalad fails to start if unable to connect to the Hive Metastore

conbody.p: Impala fails to start if it is unable to establish a connection with the Hive Metastore. This behavior was fixed, allowing Impala to start, even when no Metastore is available.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.6

concept.title: Impala treats database names as case-sensitive in some contexts

conbody.p: In some queries (including "USE database" statements), database names are treated as case-sensitive. This may lead queries to fail with an IllegalStateException.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.6

concept.title: Impala does not ignore hidden HDFS files

conbody.p: Impala does not ignore hidden HDFS files, meaning those files prefixed with a period '.' or underscore '_'. This diverges from Hive/MapReduce, which skips these files.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.6

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.5 of the Beta Release
Impala may have reduced performance on tables that contain a large number of partitions

conbody.p: Impala may have reduced performance on tables that contain a large number of partitions. This is due to extra overhead reading/parsing the partition metadata.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.5

concept.title: Backend client connections not getting cached causes an observable latency in secure clusters

conbody.p: Backend impalads do not cache connections to the coordinator. On a secure cluster, this introduces a latency proportional to the number of backend clients involved in query execution, as the cost of establishing a secure connection is much higher than in the non-secure case.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.5

concept.title: Concurrent queries may fail with error: "Table object has not been been initialised : `PARTITIONS`"

conbody.p: Concurrent queries may fail with error: "Table object has not been been initialised : `PARTITIONS`". This was due to a lack of locking in the Impala table/database metadata cache.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.5

concept.title: UNIX_TIMESTAMP format behaviour deviates from Hive when format matches a prefix of the time value

conbody.p: The Impala UNIX_TIMESTAMP(val, format) operation compares the length of format and val and returns NULL if they do not match. Hive instead effectively truncates val to the length of the format parameter.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.5

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.4 of the Beta Release
Impala fails to refresh the Hive metastore if a Hive temporary configuration file is removed

conbody.p: Impala is impacted by Hive bug HIVE-3596 which may cause metastore refreshes to fail if a Hive temporary configuration file is deleted (normally located at /tmp/hive-<user>-<tmp_number>.xml). Additionally, the impala-shell will incorrectly report that the failed metadata refresh completed successfully.
Anticipated Resolution: To be fixed in a future release
Workaround: Restart the impalad service. Use the impalad log to check for metadata refresh errors.

concept.title: lpad/rpad builtin functions is not correct.

conbody.p: The lpad/rpad builtin functions generate the wrong results.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.4

concept.title: Files with .gz extension reported as 'not supported'

conbody.p: Compressed files with extensions incorrectly generate an exception.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.4

concept.title: Queries with large limits would hang.

conbody.p: Some queries with large limits were hanging.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.4

concept.title: Order by on a string column produces incorrect results if there are empty strings

conbody.p: Resolution: Fixed in 0.4

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.3 of the Beta Release
All table loading errors show as unknown table

conbody.p: If Impala is unable to load the metadata for a table for any reason, a subsequent query referring to that table will return an unknown table error message, even if the table is known.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.3

concept.title: A table that cannot be loaded will disappear from SHOW TABLES

conbody.p: After failing to load metadata for a table, Impala removes that table from the list of known tables returned in SHOW TABLES. Subsequent attempts to query the table returns 'unknown table', even if the metadata for that table is fixed.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.3

concept.title: Impala cannot read from HBase tables that are not created as external tables in the hive metastore.

conbody.p: Attempting to select from these tables fails.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.3

concept.title: Certain queries that contain OUTER JOINs may return incorrect results

conbody.p: Queries that contain OUTER JOINs may not return the correct results if there are predicates referencing any of the joined tables in the WHERE clause.
Resolution: Fixed in 0.3.

concept.title: Issues Fixed in Version 0.2 of the Beta Release
Subqueries which contain aggregates cannot be joined with other tables or Impala may crash

conbody.p: Subqueries that contain an aggregate cannot be joined with another table or Impala may crash. For example:
conbody.codeblock: SELECT * FROM (SELECT sum(col1) FROM some_table GROUP BY col1) t1 JOIN other_table ON (...);
conbody.p: Resolution: Fixed in 0.2

concept.title: An insert with a limit that runs as more than one query fragment inserts more rows than the limit.

conbody.p: For example:
conbody.codeblock: INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE test SELECT * FROM test2 LIMIT 1;
conbody.p: Resolution: Fixed in 0.2

concept.title: Query with limit clause might fail.

conbody.p: For example:
Resolution: Fixed in 0.2

concept.title: Files in unsupported compression formats are read as plain text.
